Have I been taught the industry standard for data visualization?

Throughout my college experience I've been taught to visualize data through Python Libraries, R, Excel, Google Sheets, and Power BI, but did I learn the most part?

There are other visualization tools such as QlikView/QlikSense, SAS, Tableau, Sisense, and Looker. I hope I'm not missing anything important and well used in the industry.

I looked up 100 data analyst jobs on indeed, what tools do they use?

Without filtering, I simply looked up 50 data analyst jobs on Indeed and LinkedIn with the title "Data Analyst". 25 of the jobs were from Indeed, and 

![](Visual.png)

It appears that Excel, PowerBi, and Tableau are crutial to know in the Data Analyst role. I only took one Excel class and one PowerBI class in college and I now believe I should've taken more. It suprises me that I did not learn Tableau in college as it's so seemingly used in the real world.
